title: Miley Cyrus gay comments are harmful LGBTQ+ stereotypes
text:
Miley’s comments were harmful (Picture: Rex – Getty)

LGBTQ+ people are constantly having to validate their sexualities – but this week, opposition seemingly came from an unlikely source.

Miley Cyrus is fresh from her split from husband Liam Hemsworth and a brief relationship with Kaitlynn Carter, and is now dating bleach blond surfer Aussie heartthrob Cody Simpson – who seems to be a total catch. Fair play to Miley.

But in heaping praise on her new beau, Miley managed to claim that you don’t need to be gay, you just haven’t found the right man yet.

Speaking on her Instagram live, the 26-year-old said her ‘hardcore feminist vibes’ meant she wouldn’t let anyone in (because believing in equal rights apparently means romance is off limits).

Then she said: ‘There are good men out there, guys. Don’t give up. You don’t have to be gay, there are good people with d***s out there, you’ve just gotta find them. You gotta find a d*** that’s not a d***.

‘I always thought I had to be gay because I thought all guys were evil, but it’s not true. There are good people are out there that just happen to have d***s.’

Oh, Miley. Miley, Miley, Miley.

Miley is still pansexual when she is dating a man (Picture: Angie Simpson/Instagram)

In fairness to the star, she has since apologised, writing: ‘I was talking s*** about sucky guys, but let me be clear, YOU don’t CHOOSE your sexuality. You are born as you are. It has always been my priority to protect the LGBTQ community I am part of.’

But she should know better. Miley identifies as pansexual – being attracted to people regardless of their sex or gender identity – and has dated women and men in the past, so she should be extra-wary of the damage that throwing around dated stereotypes can have.

The majority of LBTQ+ women will have an experience of being told that liking girls is ‘just a phase’ and that they’re not gay, they just haven’t found the right man yet. This usually comes from ignorant people who refuse to believe that sexuality is not a choice, and it can be incredibly damaging for a young person to hear that whatever they’re feeling is just because they haven’t found the ‘right man’. To hear that coming from an openly LGBTQ+ person who is now in a heterosexual relationship, who has a massive platform, can be just as hurtful.

As part of the LGBTQ+ community, Miley should know better (Picture: @TheHapaBlonde / BACKGRID)

Miley also perpetuated the stereotype that lesbians/queer women are gay because they think men are evil. No, they’re LBTQ+ because they are LBTQ+. Toting lesbians as man-hating feminists is a long-held stereotype that allows others to belittle and insult the community.

Advertisement

Advertisement

I’m happy for Miley that she has found a good guy in Cody Simpson – she deserves happiness. And her sexuality isn’t invalidated by her choice of partner; she is still pansexual when she is in a heterosexual relationship, which is often hard for people to understand.

Speaking to Vanity Fair, Miley said that ‘a big part of my pride and identity is being a queer person’, and in an interview with Elle while married to Liam, she said: ‘I think it’s very confusing to people that I’m married. But my relationship is unique. And I don’t know that I would ever publicly allow people in there because it’s so complex, and modern, and new that I don’t think we’re in a place where people would get it.

‘I mean, do people really think that I’m at home in a f***ing apron cooking dinner? I’m in a hetero relationship, but I still am very sexually attracted to women.’

Miley has to explain her sexuality again and again, so she must be aware that lesbians and queer women are subject to constant ignorance about their sexualities. Sure, she didn’t actually mean that people are free to choose their sexuality, and Miley has done a lot of work for the LGBTQ+ community, including setting up a foundation to help homeless LGBTQ+ youth. But even a joke, when spread to 100 million Instagram followers, can do damage.

Advertisement

Knowing the ignorance and misinformation that is out there, Miley should know that whether she’s in an anti-man mood or not, she shouldn’t even jokingly perpetuate the idea that a) your sexuality is defined by your partner and b) your sexuality is something you can choose.

It’s hard enough being an LGBTQ+ person in the face of bigots – we need everybody in the community to be an ally too.
